hero.question: Will the DHS shutdown end after March 31, 2026?
hero.prob_take: The 10-point jump to 48% signals Democrats and moderates are suddenly pricing in real shutdown risk, likely spooked by fresh rhetoric from House hardliners or a failed funding negotiation in the last few weeks. At 52% for a shutdown extending past March 31, you're getting paid pennies for tail risk that includes debt ceiling brinksmanship, which historically forces extensions that blow past arbitrary deadlines.

daily_take.headline: DHS Shutdown Odds Jump 10 Points. Market Pricing In Political Breakdown.
daily_take.deck: The shutdown-ends-by-March-31 contract jumped from 38% to 48% in 24 hours on fresh volume. This signals renewed confidence in a deal, but 48% still feels too low for a market that historically capitulates before hard deadlines. Smart money should probe the "yes" side here, especially if odds drift back toward 45%.
